intro: Valeriana tanacetifolia, commonly known as garden valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring aromatic, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters called cymes. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, often found in meadows and woodland edges. Valeriana tanacetifolia is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in herbal remedies.
